main event: A civilian observer in Norwood, Ohio reported seeing an unusual, well-lit object the size of the moon with a dark center on June 6, 1953 around 4:50 AM.
interesting points: The observer, Arthur F. Norton, was somewhat confused and did not fully understand the incident.
The object did not leave a vapor trail and the conclusion was listed as 'Unknown'.
The observer reported the object varied in its course and was observed for 10-15 minutes.
Photographs were taken but not included in the report.
The report indicates that only the single observer saw the object and no other witnesses came forward.
sighted object: unusual, well-lit object the size of the moon with a dark center
witnesses: single civilian observer, Arthur F. Norton
photographs: yes, but not included in the report
